DOC.detailed_description: Background : The purpose study improve quality VA diabetes care use automate telephone disease management ( ATDM ) system administers patient assessment target self-care education clinic visit . Objectives : In ongoing study , determine : 1 ) reliability validity Automated Telephone Disease Management ( ATDM ) assessments patient ' glycemic control , health-related quality life ( HRQL ) , self-care , satisfaction care ; 2 ) extent assessment identify patient risk poor outcome ; 3 ) cost-effectiveness intervention ATDM assessment report provide regularly patient ' primary care provider . Methods : We refine expand previously-developed ATDM assessment instrument incorporate measure patient-centered outcome . We enrol 450 patient VISN 12 VISN 21 . Patients receive weekly ATDM assessment six month . Other data health status service use collect medical record , laboratory test , telephone survey , Austin Automation Center file . After determine concurrent reliability , validity , prognostic significance ATDM assessment , examine variation ATDM-reported outcomes across Networks , facility , patient group . In second phase study , conduct effectiveness trial one year follow period . We use finding process evaluation modify ATDM assessment design provider feedback report . We enroll 240 patient two Networks ( i.e. , 480 patient overall ) . Patients assign experimental usual care control group use combination randomization cutoff-based assignment . We measure intervention 's impact patient ' glycemic control , symptom , self-care , patient-centered outcome . We use VA cost database Medicare claim file evaluate cost-effectiveness . Status : Analyses ATDM assessment data suggest method feasible VA diabetes patient provide comparable data regard patient ' satisfaction care function telephone survey . Other analysis suggest VA interpersonal process care rate cost-related medication adherence problem good well experienced patient comparable characteristic treat system care .
